title: Eric Adams
added: When discussing the 2013 New York City Mayoral Democratic Primary, Adams said that [[Bill_de_Blasio|Bill de Blasio]] “out-blacked” [[Bill_Thompson_(New_York_politician)|William Thompson]], an African American candidate.

When discussing the 2021 New York City Mayoral Democratic Primary, Adams said that he would “out-white” [[Scott_Stringer|Scott Stringer]]. <ref>https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/24/nyregion/nyc-2021-mayor-election-candidates.html</ref>

title: Eric Adams
added: During a June 2019 press conference, Adams told New Yorkers to "go talk to the young people or the people on your block who are using fireworks"<ref>{{Cite web|last=Moore|first=Tina|last2=Lapin|first2=Tamar|date=2020-06-22|title=Brooklyn BP Eric Adams urges community not to call 311, 911 for fireworks|url=https://nypost.com/2020/06/21/brooklyn-bp-eric-adams-urges-community-not-to-call-911-for-fireworks/|access-date=2021-01-18|website=New York Post|language=en-US}}</ref> instead of calling 911 or 311. Shatavia Walls, a 33-year old woman from [[East New York, Brooklyn|East New York]], heeded this advice and was shot dead on July 7, 2020, shortly after she asked an individual to stop shooting off fireworks.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Moore|first=Tina|last2=Balsamini|first2=Dean|date=2020-07-18|title=Woman fatally shot after asking man to stop setting off fireworks|url=https://nypost.com/2020/07/18/woman-fatally-shot-after-asking-man-to-stop-setting-off-fireworks/|access-date=2021-01-18|website=New York Post|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>https://newyork.cbslocal.com/2020/07/20/illegal-fireworks-east-new-york-brooklyn-pink-houses-shatavia-walls/</ref><ref>https://www.brooklynpaper.com/opinion-just-let-the-police-do-their-jobs/</ref> Walls' mother Helen Testagros later confirmed that her daughter was aware of Adams' advice, saying: “She watched the news. Yes, she heard it. It was probably in the back of her mind.”<ref>{{Cite web|last=Sheehan|first=Kevin|last2=Moore|first2=Tina|last3=Feis|first3=Aaron|date=2020-07-19|title=Brooklyn woman killed over fireworks was following Boro Prez Eric Adams’ lead: mom|url=https://nypost.com/2020/07/19/brooklyn-lady-killed-over-fireworks-followed-eric-adams-lead-mom/|access-date=2021-01-18|website=New York Post|language=en-US}}</ref>

title: Eric Adams
deleted: During a June 2019 press conference, Eric Adams told New Yorkers to "go talk to the young people or the people on your block who are using fireworks"<ref>{{Cite web|last=Moore|first=Tina|last2=Lapin|first2=Tamar|date=2020-06-22|title=Brooklyn BP Eric Adams urges community not to call 311, 911 for fireworks|url=https://nypost.com/2020/06/21/brooklyn-bp-eric-adams-urges-community-not-to-call-911-for-fireworks/|access-date=2021-01-18|website=New York Post|language=en-US}}</ref> instead of calling 911 or 311. Shatavia Walls, a 33-year old woman from [[East New York, Brooklyn|East New York]], heeded this advice and was shot dead on July 7, 2020 shortly after she asked an individual to stop shooting off fireworks. Walls' mother Helen Testagros later confirmed that her daughter was aware of Adams' advice, saying: “She watched the news. Yes, she heard it. It was probably in the back of her mind.”<ref>{{Cite web|date=2020-07-19|title=Woman fatally shot in NYC after asking man to stop setting off fireworks|url=https://www.foxnews.com/us/nyc-woman-shot-brooklyn-fireworks-asking-man-to-stop-police|access-date=2021-02-16|website=New York Post|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Capano|first=Bob|date=2020-07-24EDT16:30:37-04:00|title=Opinion: Just let the police do their jobs! • Brooklyn Paper|url=https://www.brooklynpaper.com/opinion-just-let-the-police-do-their-jobs/|access-date=2021-02-16|website=www.brooklynpaper.com|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Moore|first=Tina|last2=Balsamini|first2=Dean|date=2020-07-18|title=Woman fatally shot after asking man to stop setting off fireworks|url=https://nypost.com/2020/07/18/woman-fatally-shot-after-asking-man-to-stop-setting-off-fireworks/|access-date=2021-01-18|website=New York Post|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Sheehan|first=Kevin|last2=Moore|first2=Tina|last3=Feis|first3=Aaron|date=2020-07-19|title=Brooklyn woman killed over fireworks was following Boro Prez Eric Adams’ lead: mom|url=https://nypost.com/2020/07/19/brooklyn-lady-killed-over-fireworks-followed-eric-adams-lead-mom/|access-date=2021-01-18|website=New York Post|language=en-US}}</ref> Adams responded by saying "My heart goes out to the family of Shatavia Walls on this horrific incident. Gun violence has hurt too many innocent people in our city, from 1-year-old Davell Gardner to this dynamic young lady. Dangerous people are shooting innocent people for senseless reasons. I renew my call for cracking down on the scourge of illegal guns."<ref>{{Cite web|last=|first=|date=2020-07-20|title=Brooklyn Mother: Daughter's Request To Stop Shooting Off Illegal Fireworks Led To Her Senseless Killing|url=https://newyork.cbslocal.com/2020/07/20/illegal-fireworks-east-new-york-brooklyn-pink-houses-shatavia-walls/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2021-02-16|website=CBS New York|language=en-US}}</ref>

title: Eric Adams
deleted: * [[2009 New York State Senate leadership crisis]]

title: Eric Adams
deleted: In August 2019, he was criticized over his inaction towards placard abuse in Brooklyn by an anonymous [[Twitter]] account. Adams responded by seemingly comparing the accuser to the [[Ku Klux Klan]], tweeting: "Your hidden face is in the tradition of others who hid themselves with white hoods".<ref>{{cite web|author=Eric Adams |url=https://twitter.com/BPEricAdams/status/1166529609380323330 |title=Eric Adams on Twitter: "Not sure of what you are talking about but the greatest level of fear is reflected in people who hide their faces while throwing insults. My life work speaks of my courage. Your hidden face is in the tradition of others who hid themselves with white hoods… " |publisher=Twitter.com |access-date=2020-01-21}}</ref> Adams later denied that this was a reference to the Klan, telling a radio station: “I was saying to him and to everyone who use Twitter as a bullying tool or to hide their faces, that those are cowardly actions."<ref>{{Cite web|date=2019-09-01|title=Eric Adams Responds Ahead Of Placard Abuse Town Hall|url=https://www.radio.com/wcbs880/articles/eric-adams-responds-ahead-placard-abuse-town-hall|access-date=2021-01-18|website=www.radio.com|language=en}}</ref>

At a town hall shortly after the incident, Adams defended illegal parking on public concrete space around the entrance to Borough Hall by saying those spots are only used by his female staffers: "The only individuals who are allowed to park private vehicles around the building are my women employees that I have told they have to respond late at night when they call."<ref>{{Cite web|last=Duggan|first=Kevin|title=Borough President Adams: If everyone else can park illegally, I can too! • Brooklyn Paper|url=https://www.brooklynpaper.com/borough-president-adams-if-everyone-else-can-park-illegally-i-can-too/|access-date=2021-01-18|website=www.brooklynpaper.com|language=en-US}}</ref>

When asked why he wouldn't stop using his placard Adams said "We won’t have an Eric Adams rule. I fought my entire life to make sure men that look like me don’t have different rules than everyone else. It’s one rule in this city. It’s not going to be a rule just for Eric Adams — the first African American borough president" <ref>https://www.amny.com/transit/parking-placard-abuse-nyc-1-35885183/</ref>

title: Eric Adams
deleted: During a June 2020 press conference, Eric Adams told New Yorkers to "go talk to the young people or the people on your block who are using fireworks"{{cn|date=February 2021}} or calling 311 instead of calling 911 and getting the police involved in the dispute.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Eric Adams says don't call 911 as fireworks boom across city|url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/video/comedy/eric-adams-says-dont-call-911-as-fireworks-boom-across-city/vi-BB15Pvm3|access-date=2021-02-16|website=www.msn.com}}</ref> Shatavia Walls, a 33-year old woman from [[East New York, Brooklyn|East New York]], heeded this advice and was shot dead on July 7, 2020 shortly after she asked an individual to stop shooting off fireworks.{{cn|date=February 2021}}<ref>{{Cite web|date=2020-07-19|title=Woman fatally shot in NYC after asking man to stop setting off fireworks|url=https://www.fox6now.com/news/woman-fatally-shot-in-nyc-after-asking-man-to-stop-setting-off-fireworks|access-date=2021-02-16|website=FOX News|language=en-US}}</ref> Walls' mother Helen Testagros later confirmed that her daughter was aware of Adams' advice, saying: “She watched the news. Yes, she heard it. It was probably in the back of her mind.”{{cn|date=February 2021}} Adams responded by saying "My heart goes out to the family of Shatavia Walls on this horrific incident. Gun violence has hurt too many innocent people in our city, from 1-year-old Davell Gardner to this dynamic young lady. Dangerous people are shooting innocent people for senseless reasons. I renew my call for cracking down on the scourge of illegal guns."<ref>{{Cite web|last=|first=|date=2020-07-20|title=Brooklyn Mother: Daughter's Request To Stop Shooting Off Illegal Fireworks Led To Her Senseless Killing|url=https://newyork.cbslocal.com/2020/07/20/illegal-fireworks-east-new-york-brooklyn-pink-houses-shatavia-walls/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2021-02-16|website=CBS New York|language=en-US}}</ref>
